view

Class AnimatedRenderable

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.Renderable
      • view.AnimatedRenderable

  • public class AnimatedRenderable
extends Renderable
    Renderable that supports animations. All the animation frames have to be stored in the same file and and alligned horizontally. All the frames have to be the same size. Object has to be added to the rendering queue every frame to appear on the screen. To achieve the animation effect call the animate method every frame.
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimatedRenderable

        public AnimatedRenderable(java.lang.String ImageName,
                  int PosX,
                  int PosY,
                  int Width,
                  int Height,
                  int DepthLevel,
                  int numberOfFrames,
                  int currentFrame)
        Constructor initializes a renderable. Some values get set to default values and need to be accessed using getters/setters.
        Parameters:
        ImageName - name of the file that stores the image.
        PosX - Horizontal coordinates of the top left corner of the image.
        PosY - Vertical coordinates of the top left corner of the image.
        Width - Width of the image on the screen. Image will get resized if the value supplied doesnt match the real size.
        Height - Height of the image on the screen. Image will get resized if the value supplied doesnt match the real size.
        DepthLevel - Also known as Z level, images get sorted based on this value in the rendering queue. Images with lower Z will get rendered first and images with higher Z will be rendered last and possibly on top of already drawn images.
        numberOfFrames - number of frames that the image stores.
        currentFrame - the frame that the renderable displays first.

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentFrame

        public void setCurrentFrame(int n)
        Flips to the frame that should be displayed. If n exceeds the maximum number of frames the first (0) frame will get displayed instead.
        Parameters:
        n - number of the frame. Frame numbering starts with 0 rather than 1

      • getCurrentFrame

        public int getCurrentFrame()
        Returns the index of the frame that is currently being displayed.
        Returns:
        frame index

      • animate

        public void animate(long d)
        Animates the renderable and should be called every loop cycle.
        Parameters:
        d - time that has passed since the last call

      • setFrameTime

        public void setFrameTime(long t)
        Sets how fast the object should flip through the frames.
        Parameters:
        t - duration of a single frame

      • getFrameTime

        public long getFrameTime()
        Returns how fast the object flips through the frames
        Returns:
        duration of a single frame
